title: Analytics | Splits Network Platform
description: Real-time recruiting analytics built into the Splits Network platform. Track pipeline health, recruiter performance, placement metrics, and revenue forecasting in one dashboard.
author: Splits Network

blocks.subtitle: Real-time visibility into every metric that matters. Pipeline health, recruiter performance, placement trends, and revenue forecasting — all in one dashboard built for recruiting operations.
blocks.imageAlt: Recruiting analytics dashboard showing pipeline and revenue metrics

blocks.heading: Recruiting Without Data Is Guesswork
paragraphs: Most recruiting teams manage their operations across spreadsheets, email threads, and disconnected tools. The result: no clear picture of what's working, where candidates are stalling, or which recruiters are performing.

Splits Network analytics changes that. Every submission, every stage transition, every placement, and every fee is tracked automatically. You get the complete picture without building the infrastructure yourself.

items.title: Pipeline Health
items.description: See how many candidates are active at each stage across all open roles. Identify bottlenecks before they become missed deadlines.

items.title: Recruiter Performance
items.description: Track submission-to-interview rates, interview-to-offer ratios, and placements per recruiter. Know who's delivering.

items.title: Revenue Forecasting
items.description: Model expected placement revenue based on active pipeline. Includes guarantee period tracking and projected payout dates.

items.title: Time-to-Fill
items.description: Measure average time from role posting to accepted offer, by role type, seniority level, and recruiter.

items.title: Source Attribution
items.description: Understand which recruiters and candidate sources drive your most successful hires. Allocate your fee budget where it delivers.

items.title: Activity Heatmaps
items.description: Visualize submission volume, interview scheduling, and offer activity by day and week. Plan capacity with confidence.

blocks.heading: Know Who's Performing
paragraphs: When multiple recruiters are working your roles, knowing who to engage more — and who to let go — is the difference between a fast hire and a stalled one.

items.title: Ranked Leaderboards
items.body: Compare recruiters by placement rate, speed, and candidate quality score across any time period.

items.title: Trend Analysis
items.body: See whether performance is improving or declining week over week. Act on the signal before it becomes a pattern.

items.title: Submission Quality
items.description: Track what percentage of submitted candidates make it to interview stage. Quality is measurable.
items.body: Track what percentage of submitted candidates advance. Quality, not just volume, is what the metric reveals.

blocks.quote: We cut our time-to-fill by 30% in one quarter by using the pipeline analytics to identify exactly where candidates were stalling. The data was always there — we just couldn't see it before.

cards.title: Hiring Companies

cards.title: Recruiting Leads

cards.title: Finance Teams
cards.description: Forecast recruiting fee spend with confidence. Every pending payout, every guarantee period, every projected revenue — tracked.

items.question: Is analytics available on all plans?
items.answer: Core metrics — pipeline health, placement counts, and basic recruiter activity — are available on all plans. Advanced analytics including revenue forecasting, heatmaps, and custom exports are Pro and Enterprise features.

items.question: How current is the data?
items.answer: Dashboard metrics refresh in real time as activity occurs on the platform. Revenue forecasting models are recalculated daily based on current pipeline state.

items.question: Can I export analytics data?
items.answer: Pro and Enterprise plans include CSV and Excel exports for all dashboard reports. Enterprise plans also include API access for connecting to your BI tools of choice.

items.question: Are analytics shared between recruiters and companies?
items.answer: No. Companies see analytics for their roles and the recruiters working them. Recruiters see their own performance data. Neither party sees the other's private pipeline data.
